summary: Physicians, dentists, and other practitioners who want to provide care at military hospitals and clinics must receive permission from the Department of Defense to do so. DOD routinely monitors providers at military facilities to make sure they provide safe, high-quality care. What happens if the care a provider gives is questioned? DOD reviews such concerns and determines whether to limit or revoke a provider's permission...
title: Military Health Care: Defense Health Agency Processes for Responding to Provider Quality and Safety Concerns
